title: Christmas Sugar Cookie Martini - Is the Only Holiday Drink You Need This Year
author: Anjali
customtime: no resting time required: 0 minutes minutes
actualsteps:
Rim the Glass: On a small plate, spread out the holiday sprinkles. Take your martini glass and either dip the rim in vanilla frosting or brush melted white chocolate around the edge. Immediately dip the rim into the sprinkles to coat evenly. Set the glass aside.
Combine Ingredients: Fill a cocktail shaker halfway with ice cubes. Add the whipped cream vodka, Irish cream, amaretto, and half-and-half.
Shake: Secure the lid on the shaker and shake vigorously for 15 to 20 seconds, until the outside of the shaker feels very cold and frosty.
Serve: Strain the cocktail mixture into the prepared, rimmed martini glass.
Garnish: Hook a mini candy cane on the side of the glass and serve immediately.
ingredient1: 1.5 oz Whipped Cream Vodka (or Vanilla Vodka)
ingredient4: 1 oz Half-and-Half (or heavy cream for extra richness)
ingredient6: 1 tablespoon Vanilla frosting or melted white chocolate
ingredient7: ¼ cup Holiday Sprinkles (red, green, and white)

title: Mini Eggs Easter Cookies
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
Preheat the oven to 350°F and line a baking dish with parchment paper or silicone mat and set aside.
In a medium sized mixing bowl, whisk together, Flour, Baking Powder and Salt. Set aside.
Use a stand mixer or hand held mixer to beat together Butter, Brown Sugar, Vanilla, and Eggs. Beat for about 1 minute until creamy.
Stir in the dry ingredients, chocolate chips and lightly cracked Cadbury Mini Eggs. Beat lightly for about a minute on low.
Take 1.5 tablespoon of the cookie dough and roll into balls. Place them on the baking dish, about 2 inches apart. Bake for 10-12 minutes.
After the cookies gets baked and are crispy and golden brown around the edges, stuff in more whole mini eggs on the top. Bake for 2 more minutes.
Allow the baked cookies to stay in the hot oven for 5 more minutes.
Remove from the baking dish and cool them on a wire rack. Sprinkle flaky Sea Salt on top. Serve with milk.
ingredient4: ½ cup Unsalted Butter 1 stick (softened to room temp)
ingredient9: 1 cup Mini Cadbury Eggs halved or lightly cracked
ingredient10: Flaked Sea Salt to sprinkle on the cookies (optional)

title: Spooky Jack Skellington Linzer Cookies
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
Preheat the oven to 350F or 180C and line a baking dish with parchment paper
Combine all the ingredients to make the shortbread cookie dough. Roll them out and cut into circles using a cookie cutter. Bake them for 10 min
Combine icing sugar with milk and green food color to make green glaze.
Once the baked cookies cool down, dip half of them in the green glaze and let the excess drip off.
Use the back of a nozzle to cut out eyes. Apply some melted dark chocolate over the other halves of the cookies.
Place them over each other to bring these Jack Skellington Cookies to life. Use the leftover melted dark chocolate to make the eyes and mouth of these Jack Skellington Cookies.
Serve when sets

title: Easy Halloween Blood Splatter Cookies
author: Anjali
customtime: no resting time required: 0 minutes minutes
actualsteps:
Preheat the oven to 350F or 180C and line a baking dish with parchment paper.
Whisk the melted butter and sugar until combined through. Add the Almond Flour, Almond Extract & Eggs. Combine everything to make your sugar cookie dough
Roll them into cookies and bake @350F or 180C for 15 min. Allow them to cool down to room temp.
Dip the cookies in melted white chocolate and allow them to sit for 5-10 min so that the chocolate sets on top.
Use the leftover melted white chocolate along with a drop of red food color to make fake blood. Splatter it unevenly over the cookies & serve.

title: Healthy Dark Chocolate Whey Protein Cookies
author: Anjali
customtime: no resting time required: 0 minutes minutes
actualsteps:
Preheat the oven to 350F or 180C and line a baking dish with Parchment Paper.
Mash the Bananas in a bowl using a fork. Add the melted peanut butter to it and whisk until combined.
Next add the chocolate protein powder and unsweetened cocoa powder to it and fold until combined. Do not over mix.
Next melt dark chocolate in a microwave safe bowl in the oven for 30 seconds and pour this melted dark chocolate over the cookie dough. Also add the chocolate chips. Fold everything well until combined.
Scoop out cookie dough using a melon scooper and transfer to a lined baking dish. Flatten out the top using the back of a spoon.
Bake @350F or 180C for 12-15 min. Once the cookies gets baked, allow them to stay in the oven for 5 more minutes so that they firm up. Allow the cookies to cool down to room temperature for 5 min and serve hot.
ingredient6: ¼ cup Dark Chocolate Chips 50gm or 1.8Oz

title: 5 ingredient Blueberry Cookies (with whey protein) - fresh blueberry cookies recipe
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
Preheat oven to 180C/350F. Line a large 9x13-inch baking pan with parchment paper. Set aside.
Combine oats, peanut butter, protein powder, and bananas in a large mixing bowl. Mix well until you see no specs of dry oats and the bananas are mixed completely.
Add in blueberries and fold lightly.
Use a cookie scoop (any size you prefer) to scoop out a portion of the blueberry cookie dough. Place them on the prepared baking sheet.
Press the cookies so that they resemble actual old-fashioned blueberry cookies. Make sure there is at least a 1-inch gap between each cookie.
Bake them in the oven for 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown on the edges.
Remove from oven and allow them to cool down completely before transferring to a wire rack for further cooling.
ingredient1: 2 cups rolled oats use gluten-free if needed
ingredient2: ½ cup peanut butter see notes for replacements
ingredient3: 1 scoop protein powder unflavored or vanilla protein powder

title: Snowman Cookies Starbucks recipe
author: Anjali
totaltime: Total Time: 4 hours hours 12 minutes minutes
actualsteps:
Whisk dry ingredients in a medium-size mixing bowl.
In a large mixing bowl using a hand held mixer or stand mixer combine unsalted butter and sugar on high speed for 2-minute. Add the egg, vanilla extract, and almond extract.
Combine wet ingredients and dry ingredients and form a dough. If you feel the dough is too soft and isn't in a rolling consistency then add 1 tablespoon more flour or until it is in a better consistency for rolling.
Divide the dough into two equal parts.
Lightly flour a nonstick silicone mat or a piece of parchment paper. Roll the dough until its about 1/4 inch thick. The shape of the rolled dough doesn't matter.
Stack the rolled out dough with a piece of parchment paper in between the two onto a 15x21 inch large baking sheet.
Refrigerate for at least 2 hours or for 2 days. If you are chilling for more than 2 hours then top the rolled out dough with a piece of parchment paper.
Once the dough is chilled, preheat oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C).
Line a 15x21 inch large baking sheet with a piece of parchment paper.
Remove one of the dough pieces from the refrigerator and use a snowman cookie cutter to cut out as many snowmen as you can. Re-roll the remaining dough to make more snowmen. Repeat the same with the other piece of dough.
Arrange the snowmen cookies on a lined baking sheet keeping a gap of at least 3-inches between each cookie.
Bake for 12-minutes or until lightly browned on the edges.
Allow the cookies to cool down on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring them onto a wired rack for further cooling. I like to wait until the cookies cool down completely before decorating them.
Finally, bring them back to the baking sheet. I prefer decorating them on the baking sheet. That way, I can keep them in the refrigerator to speed up the chilling process.
Whisk all of the ingredients for icing using a hand-held mixture or a stand-mixer with a whisk attachment. Whisk on high for 1-2 minutes.
The consistency should be silky smooth. Lift up the icing using a spatula and it should flow down slowly taking 5-10 seconds to fall into the icing bowl.
If the icing is too thick then add more water. I generally add 10-12 tablespoons or more of water if my icing is too thick.
If the icing is too watery, then add a little more confectioners' sugar.
You will need five small bowls. Arrange the icing in each bowl. Remember you will need significantly more white icing than any other color. So divide the icing accordingly.
Use red food color for the first, orange for the second, black for the third, brown for the fourth and leave the last one white.
Spoon the icing in individual reusable or disposable piping bags.
Use round tip #5 or round icing tip #4 to cover the snowmen with white, leaving space for the hat. Allow the white to set. Put the baking sheet in the refrigerator to speed up the cooling process.
Next use the same icing tip (i.e. #5 or #4) to pipe the red scarf.
Now use round icing tip #1 to pipe the hats with brown icing.
Use the same round icing tip #1 to pipe the black buttons and eyes.
Finally use the same round icing tip #1 to pipe the orange nose.
And, lastly, use the same icing tip i.e. round icing tip #1 to pipe white polka dots on the scarf.
Leave out the decorated snowman cookies at room temperature for 2 hours.
Enjoy the snowman cookies right away. Or wait until the icing sets completely. Once the icing has set you can send these to your neighbours or keep them in your snowman cookie jar or send them to someone as a christmas gift.
These decorated snowman sugar cookies will stay soft and fresh for up to 5 days when kept tightly closed in a container at room room temperature.
If you want to keep them for a longer duration, cover tightly and refrigerate for up to 10 days.
ingredient1: 2 and ¼ cups all purpose flour 280g (spooned and leveled)
ingredient4: ¾ cup (1 and ½ stick) unsalted butter softened to room temperature (170g)
ingredient13: black, orange, red, and brown food coloring

title: Easy Pumpkin Crinkle Cookies with Cake Mix
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees and set aside. Line a cookie baking sheet with parchment paper or silicone mat and set it aside.
In a medium sized mixing bowl combine cake mix, kosher salt, and pumpkin pie spice. Whisk until combined and set aside.
In a large bowl using a hand held mixer or stand mixer fitted with paddle attachment beat butter, brown sugar, and granulated sugar until light and fluffy at medium high speed for 2-3 min. Add the egg, pumpkin puree, and vanilla extract and beat on high speed until combined. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as per requirement.
Add wet ingredients to the dry ingredients.
Beat on low or Gently fold using a spatula until well incorporated. Your dough should be lightly wet and somewhat sticky.
Cover the cookie dough with a plastic wrap. Refrigerate for 3 hours. Allow to sit at room temp for 10 min. This will make the cookie dough easier to scoop and roll.
Add confectioner's sugar in a shallow bowl.
Use about 1.5 to 2 tablespoon size scoop to scoop the dough. Coat them with granulated sugar.
Place them directly into the bowl with powdered sugar and roll them generously.
Gently roll it around with your fingers or using a fork until thoroughly coated. Make sure there is a heavy coating of confectioner's sugar to get a nice crinkle effect. Do not shake off any excess sugar.
Place them on the prepared baking sheet 3-inches apart.
Bake at 375 degrees for 10-12 minutes or until firm.
Remove the cookies from oven and let them cool down for 2 minutes in the hot baking dish. Transfer to a wire cooling rack and cool before you serve them.
ingredient4: ½ cup unsalted butter softened to room temp ( 1 stick, 115g)
ingredient5: ½ cup packed light brown sugar 100g
ingredient8: 1 cup pumpkin puree not pie filling

title: Easy Christmas Tree Cookies
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
PreHeat Oven to 350F or 180C. Grease a baking ray with cooking spray and keep it aside.
In a large mixing bowl mix All Purpose Flour with Granulated Sugar, melted Unsalted Butter, Vanilla Extract, Corn Starch, and a pinch of salt. Mix well. Add 1 teaspoon of ice-cold water and knead the dough with your hands. Add water as per requirement. Make a soft dough. See the image for reference. Chill the dough covered with a plastic wrap, in the refrigerator for 15-minutes
Now, flour the surface. Roll the dough lightly making sure that it is about 3/8 inches thick. Now use a Christmas tree shaped cookie cutter to cut out small christmas tree shaped cookies. Place it on a baking sheet greased with cooking spray. Bake it in a preheated oven at 350F or 180C for 10-11 minutes. Do not touch after it is baked. Let it stay in the baking tray for another 10-minutes at room temperature. Then transfer to wire rack and let them cool down for another 10-minutes.
In a small bowl mix powdered sugar with honey, milk, and vanilla extract. Mix well. Add a few drops of green gel food color and stir well until smooth.
Now dip the sugar cookies individually in the glaze. Drip the excess by holding it vertically. Place it on a baking sheet.
Now add red and green Christmas Nonpareils Sprinkles and let the cookies sit for a while. And, then Enjoy!
ingredient2: ½ Cup Granulated Sugar 100g or 3.55 Oz
ingredient3: 1 Teaspoon Pure Vanilla Extract you can replace this with Almond Extract or Peppermint Extract
ingredient4: 2 Cups All-Purpose Flour more for dusting the surface
ingredient7: Ice Cold Water as per requirement
ingredient13: Red and Green Christmas Nonpareils Sprinkles

title: Best Gingerbread cookies Recipe
author: Anjali
customtime: chill dough for 3-4 hours: 4 hours hours
totaltime: Total Time: 4 hours hours 20 minutes minutes
actualsteps:
Take a large bowl and beat the butter for about 1 -2 minutes using a stand mixer or a handheld mixer. Beat the butter until it gets smooth and creamy. Add the Brown Sugar, Molasses, Vanilla Extract, and Eggs. Beat on high speed for about 2 minutes. Scrape down the sides and beat until smooth and creamy.
In a separate mixing bowl whisk the dry ingredients - Flour, Baking powder, Baking Soda, Ground Cinnamon, Ground Cloves, Ground Ginger, Kosher Salt, and Allspice.
Combine the wet mixture with the dry mixture to make a dough. The Gingerbread cookie dough will be slightly sticky to touch. Pat it down to make a disc shape. Divide the cookie dough into two halves. Wrap each with plastic foil and refrigerate for at least 3-4 hours or for about 3 days.
First of all, preheat your oven to about 350 degrees Fahrenheit. Then take a baking sheet and line it up with parchment paper. You can also alternatively use silicone baking mats as they are best for baking cookies. 
Now take out your chilled discs of cookie dough and place them on the kitchen surface. Spread plenty of flour underneath so that the dough does not stick to the surface. Then take a large rolling pin and roll out the dough into a flat sheet of about ¼ of an inch thickness. 
Once you have rolled out the dough into a flat sheet you can start cutting shapes into it. Use a cookie cutter for making fun shape with your family. This is the most fun part of making gingerbread cookies! 
Once you have cut all the shapes you can place them on the baking sheet. Make sure each shape is spaced evenly and has space to breathe and expand. Now all you need to do is slide the baking sheet into the oven and let the cookies bake for about ten minutes. 
Once the baking time is over take the cookies out of the oven and let them rest for about five minutes on the countertop. This way the cookies can cool down. When they are sufficiently cooled down you can decorate them with any icing of your choice. 
Your gingerbread cookies are now ready! Serve them to your family or hang them on your Christmas tree!

title: Halloween Crinkle Cookies
author: Anjali
customtime: 10 min in the freezer: 10 minutes minutes
actualsteps:
Whisk Flour, Baking Soda, Baking Powder and Kosher Salt in a medium sized mixing bowl until combined
In another medium sized mixing bowl, add the melted butter, granulated sugar, Vanilla Extract, Red Food Color and Milk. Beat until combined using a stand mixer or hand held mixer.
Combine the wet and dry mixture. Fold using a rubber or wooden spatula just until combined. The cookie dough should be thick and sticky. Wrap the cookie dough with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight or freeze for 10-15 minutes. Right before using it again, pull it out of the freezer and allow to sit at room temperature for 5-10 minutes. Meanwhile Preheat the oven to 350 F or 180C and line a baking dish with parchment paper or silicone mat.
Scoop about 1 tablespoon of the cookie dough. Roll it into balls. Roll the cookies with confectioners sugar. Place in the baking dish about 3 inches apart.
Bake for 10-11 minutes. If the cookies do not spread even after 9 minutes, get the baking dish out and lightly bang on the counter for 2-3 times or just use a spatula to lightly press the top. This will help initiate the spreading. Bake for 2-3 more minutes.
After the cookies gets cooked, allow them to cool down on the wire rack.
These cookies will stay fresh at room temp. for upto 1 week.
ingredient5: 4 drops Red Gel Food Color or Red Candy Melts (1 cup)
ingredient7: 1 stick Unsalted Butter melted or softened to room temp.

title: Zucchini Cookies with Cream Cheese Frosting
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
Preheat the oven to 350F (OR 180C). Line a cookie baking dish with parchment paper. Trim off the tip and stem of the Zucchini. Shred the zucchini using a box grater. Use a kitchen towel and firmly squeese to get rid of all the moisture from the Zucchini. Keep this shredded Zucchini aside in a bowl.
Now, take a mixing bowl. Throw the softened butter, brown sugar, vanilla extract, and shredded Zucchini in it. Use a handheld mixer to beat this until combined through. Beat until the sugar and butter are combined thoroughly.
Add the Rolled Oats, AP Flour, Baking Soda, and Kosher Salt to the wet mixture. Fold until combined. The cookie dough should not be wet. It should be absolutely dry. Freeze the cookie dough for 15 minutes or refrigerate for 1 hour before use.
Now, scoop out one tablespoon size cookie dough and place it on a lined baking dish. Bake these zucchini cookies @ 350F for 11 to 12 minutes. (After the cookies get baked, allow them to stay in the same hot baking dish for 5 more minutes. After that, transfer to a wire rack for even cooling. Cool the cookies down to room temperature.
In a bowl, beat Cream Cheese, Granulated Sugar, and Vanilla Extract. Beat until it gets light, creamy, and fluffy. Spoon this cream cheese frosting over the cooled Zucchini Cookies. Sprinkle some ground cinnamon over the cookies and serve.
ingredient13: ½ teaspoon Ground Cinnamon to dust on top

title: No-Bake Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Bars (Gluten-Free) | (No Condensed Milk)
author: Anjali
customtime: allow it to freeze: 30 minutes minutes
actualsteps:
Blend ingredients in a food processor until it becomes "sticky" and comes together like a ball.
Take the ball out in a medium-sized mixing bowl. Add chocolate chips and stir lightly with a spatula to combine.
Prepare a baking tray with parchment paper. Place the cookie dough into the baking tray. Press it down and freeze until it completely sets.
Melt dark chocolate chunks or chocolate chips with coconut oil in microwave or in a double boiler. It should be silky smooth.
Pour melted chocolate on the cookie dough bars and freeze for another 10-15 minutes.
Cut them into bars and serve.
ingredient7: ½ cup dark unsweetened chocolate chips
ingredient8: 3 oz dark chocolate bars can replace with 90grams chocolate chips

title: Flourless Oatmeal Raisin Cookies (Vegan | GF) (just 4 ingredients)!
author: Anjali
customtime: no resting time required: 0 minutes minutes
actualsteps:
In a mixing bowl, combine all the ingredients to make the cookie dough. If your cookie dough feels too dry add some more Cashew Butter. If its too thin, then add some rolled Oats.
Roll 1 tablespoon size of the cookie dough and flatten it between your palms. Place it in a greased baking dish. Bake @350F or 180C for 10-12 minutes. Allow the cookies to stay in the hot oven for 5 extra minutes before you transfer them to a wire rack to get further cooled. Enjoy!
ingredient3: 1 tablespoon Maple (optional) can skip for keto & paleo version

title: Brown Butter Chocolate Chip Cookies (Simple Ingredients)
author: Anjali
totaltime: Total Time: 1 hour hour 16 minutes minutes
actualsteps:
Make Browned Butter by melting Butter in a pan. As the butter melts, whisk with a balloon whisk. It will start to bubble and after 1 minute it will change color to brown. The moment it gets light brown, take it off the heat and allow it to cool down in a separate bowl.
Meanwhile, whisk the dry ingredients - Flour, Baking Soda, Baking Powder, and salt in a bowl and keep aside.
Now, mix the wet ingredients - milk, browned butter, light brown sugar, granulated sugar, vanilla in a bowl using a wire whisk or a handheld mixer until combined.
Now, simply fold the dry ingredients into the wet sugar and butter mixture. Add the Chocolate Chips and mix everything. Do not overmix. Just mix until combined. Cover with plastic wrap and store in the refrigerator for 1 hour. Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350F or 180C. Line a cookie baking dish with a silicone mat or parchment paper.
Scoop out 1/4 cup of cookie dough ball and place in a lined baking dish. Bake for 11-12 minutes. After they get baked, allow them to stay in the hot pan for 5 minutes and then transfer to the wire rack for further cooling
Sprinkle some Sea Salt and Serve.
ingredient7: ¼ cup Whole Milk can replace with 2% milk or almond milk

title: Red Velvet Sugar Cookies with White Chocolate Hearts
author: Anjali
customtime: Allowing the cookie dough to Refrigerate: 30 minutes minutes
actualsteps:
Add Softened Unsalted Butter Granulated sugar in a large mixing bowl. Use a handheld mixer or stand mixer and whisk at high speed for a minute until the mixture gets light, fluffy and creamy.
Into this add Pure Vanilla Extract and Egg. Whisk on low speed until the egg combines.
Now add Red Gel Food Coloring. You can also use beet powder (if you prefer natural color) and beat until combined. Scrape the sides of the bowl and beat again if required.
In a separate mixing bowl, whisk together, All-Purpose Flour, Baking Soda, Salt, and Cocoa Powder. Whisk until combined.
Add this dry mixture to the wet mixture and fold until combined, using a wooden or silicone spatula. The cookie dough will be soft now. If its too soft, you can add a tablespoon of flour.
Take about 1 Tablespoon of cookie dough and roll into small balls. Arrange these Red Velvet Cookie Dough balls in a greased and lined baking sheet. Refrigerate these cookie dough balls for 1-2 hours or for 2 days.
Next, Preheat the oven to 350°F
Press the cookies and flatten them, using a spatula. Bake them in a preheated oven at 350°F for 10-12 minutes. They will spread in the oven so make sure you keep a gap of at least 1-inch between each cookie.
Once cookies are baked they will be soft and delicate. Don't take them out of the baking tray yet. Let them sit in the hot baking dish, at room temperature for 10-20 minutes.
After 20-minutes, add White chocolate Candy hearts and sort of push it in lightly. Then enjoy!
ingredient1: ¾ cup Unsalted Butter softened to room temperature
ingredient10: 24 small White Chocolate Hearts I used Reese's hearts (optional)

title: Valentine's Day Sugar Cookie Bars with Heart M&Ms
author: Anjali
totaltime: Total Time: 1 hour hour 35 minutes minutes
actualsteps:
In a large mixing bowl, whisk together, Flour, Baking Powder, and Salt, until combined.
Pour Milk, Melted Unsalted Butter, Granulated Sugar, Brown Sugar, and Vanilla Extract into the bowl and stir until combined.
Pour the sugar cookie batter into the baking dish. Top with Heart-shaped M&Ms. Pop it in the oven and bake for 30 minutes. After it gets baked, allow it to cool down for 1 hour.
Cut it into squares of equal sizes and serve.

title: Southern Ginger Molasses Cookies
author: Anjali
customtime: Allowing the cookies to chill in the freezer: 20 minutes minutes
actualsteps:
Preheat the oven to 350F or 180C and Whisk the Flour, Baking Soda, Ground Ginger, All Spice, and Salt in a bowl.
Now, add the Brown Sugar, Dark Molasses, Vanilla Extract, and Whole Milk to the dry ingredients. Stir to combine. The cookie dough should be thick. If it's too liquidy, add some more flour and combine. If it's too dry, add a splash of milk and combine
Roll cookie dough balls and freeze them for 10 minutes before you bake them at 350F or 180C for 15 min.
After the cookies get baked, allow them to cool down in the same pan for 5 minutes, before transferring them to the wire rack.

title: Candy Cane Crinkle Cookies
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
Whisk the Flour, Baking Powder, Baking Soda, and Salt in a bowl.
Add the Granulated Sugar, Unsalted butter, Vanilla Extract, Peppermint Oil, Pink Gel Food Color OR Melted Pink Candy Melts, and Egg in a separate bowl.
Fold it to the flour mixture and combine everything using a wooden spoon or spatula.
Roll small cookie dough balls. Roll the cookie dough balls in powdered sugar. Allow them to sit. After 2 minutes, re-roll them in the powdered sugar.
Allow the cookie dough to freeze covered for 5 minutes or refrigerate for 1-2 hours or overnight. Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350°F or 180°C.
Bake these Candy Cane Crinkle Cookies for 10 minutes. After these are baked, allow them to cool down in the same baking dish for 5 minutes. Serve warm.
ingredient1: 1½ cups AP Flour use Gluten Free Baking flour for GF Version
ingredient2: ¼ teaspoon Baking Soda use Gluten Free Baking Soda for GF Version
ingredient3: ¼ teaspoon Baking Powder use Gluten Free Baking Powder for GF Version
ingredient6: ½ cup Unsalted Butter softened to room temp (1 stick, 115g)
ingredient9: 1 drop Pink Gel Food Color or Pink Candy Melts (one 12oz pack)
ingredient11: Powdered sugar to roll the cookies

title: Hot Chocolate Cookies
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
To make the hot chocolate cookie dough, take the flour, baking soda, cocoa powder, and cornstarch in a bowl. Mix well. Now, add the softened butter, granulated sugar, vanilla extract, egg, milk, and chocolate chips to the batter and combine using a wooden spoon to make a thick cookie dough. (See the video for a visual)
Cover and freeze the cookie dough for 20 minutes or refrigerate for 1 hour.
Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350F or 180C
After the cookie dough is chilled, roll the cookie dough balls. Press it slightly to flatten it out. Stuff a chopped marshmallows in the center of the cookie. Stuff more chocolate chips around it. Pop it in the freezer for 20 more minutes and then bake for 10 minutes
After the cookies have been baked, allow them to stay in the same hot baking dish for 5 minutes on the counter, so that they harden a little. Drizzle with some chocolate syrup or melt some dark melting wafers in the oven and drizzle over your baked cookies. Allow the chocolate drizzle to harden for some time and then serve!
ingredient2: ¼ cup Dutch Processed Cocoa Powder
ingredient10: 2 tablespoon whole milk can replace with 2% milk or Almond Milk
ingredient11: ½ cup Unsweetened Chocolate chips more for topping

title: Eggless-Flourless Chocolate Fudge Cookies
author: Anjali
customtime: Allowing the cookies to cool down: 20 minutes minutes
actualsteps:
In a medium-sized mixing bowl mix granulated sugar, melted butter, cocoa powder, chocolate chips, a pinch of salt, and chocolate syrup using a silicone spatula or a wooden spatula.
Use a spoon to scoop out a portion of cookie dough. Roll it between your palms. Keep it on a greased baking sheet. Keep the cookies in the freezer for about 5-10 minutes.
In the Meantime Preheat your oven to 350F or 180C.
After 10-minutes, take the cookies out of the freezer and allow them to bake for 10-minutes at 350F. Once done, they will look soft and underbaked. They might spread a bit. But, don't worry, let them cool down.
Once they have cooled down completely use an offset spatula and delicately take them out of the baking tray. Enjoy.
ingredient4: ½ Cup Unsweetened Chocolate Chips (sugar free chocolate chips)

title: Chocolate Dipped Shortbread Christmas Cookies
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
In a large bowl combine flour, sugar, salt, vanilla extract, and cold butter. Cut the butter using a pastry blender. Now, use your hands to combine the butter and flour until it gets coarse and mealy OR just pulse all of these in a food processor for 1-2 pulses or until crumbly.
Add a few teaspoons of ice-cold water to bring it all together and make a soft dough.
If you're making the cookie dough in the food processor, then after pulsing the mixture, get it out in a bowl. Add a tablespoon or two of ice cold water and bring it all together to make a cookie dough. The cookie dough should be come together easily and should be soft to touch.
Cover the cookie dough with plastic wrap and freeze the cookie dough for 10-minutes or Refrigerate for 1 hour. (Ideally it should be refrigerated for 1 hour or overnight, but if you're in a rush, just freeze it and then use it)
After the cookie dough is chilled, roll it on a lightly floured surface to about 1-inch thickness. It will be hard to roll in the beginning, but keep rolling and it will spread gradually and evenly. Use a round shaped cookie cutter to cut out the cookies and gently place them on a greased baking dish or a cookie baking dish lined with Parchment paper or silicone mat.
Freeze the cookies uncovered for 5 more minutes. Meanwhile, Preheat your oven to 350F or 180C.
Bake the cookies for 10-11 minutes. Once they are done, allow them to come down to room temperature on the same baking sheet. After some time, you can transfer it to a wire rack and allow them to cool down completely.
Melt Dark chocolate or dark melting wafers in the oven at 30-second bursts whisking after each burst.
After the cookies have cooled down, dip half of the cookies into the melted chocolate.
Top with Christmas nonpareils sprinkles.
Allow the chocolate to set for 5-minutes at room temperature and then serve.
ingredient3: 2 Sticks Unsalted Cold Butter Cut into small cubes (226g or 1 Cup)
ingredient6: 10 Oz Unsweetened Dark Chocolate Baking Bar or Dark Melting Wafers
ingredient7: Ice Cold Water 1 teaspoon at a time

title: Peppermint Bark Shortbread Cookies
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
Make the cocoa cookie dough. For that combine 1 cup of AP Flour with the cocoa powder, 1 tablespoon of cornstarch, and 1 stick of softened butter. Add a pinch of salt, 1/2 cup of granulated sugar, and 1 teaspoon of Vanilla extract. Mix everything to make a dough. If the dough is too dry and not coming together, add a few teaspoon of ice-cold water and combine everything with your hands to make a dough. Cover and freeze the dough for 20 min or refrigerate for 1 hour.
Now it's time to make similar cookie dough but without the cocoa. So for this take 1 cup of flour, 1 tablespoon of cornstarch, a pinch of salt, and 1 stick of softened butter in a separate bowl. Add 1/2 cup of Granulated sugar and 1 teaspoon of Peppermint extract. Make a dough by adding a few teaspoon of ice-cold water. Cover and freeze the dough for 20 min or refrigerate for 1 hour.
Roll both the cookie dough on a lightly floured surface. Do not roll it too thin.
Use a cookie cutter to cut out the cookies and place one on top of the other. The cocoa side should be at the bottom. Place the cookie carefully on to your cookie baking dish. Freeze the cookies for 5-10 more minutes and then pop them in the oven to get baked for 10 minutes.
After the cookies get baked, allow them to stay in the same pan for 5 minutes at room temperature so that they harden a little.
For the glaze combine granulated sugar with vanilla and a splash of milk in a bowl. Once it gets thick, drizzle it lightly over the baked cookies. Top with some broken Peppermint candy canes. Allow the cookies to sit on the counter for 5 minutes so that the glaze hardens and then serve.

title: Peppermint White Chocolate Chip Cookie Cake Recipe from Scratch
author: Anjali
customtime: Cooling the Cookie Cake: 15 minutes minutes
actualsteps:
Preheat oven to 350F or 180C and grease a 9-inch springform cake pan with non-stick cooking spray or brush with vegetable oil. Set Aside.
Using a handheld mixer or stand mixer with a paddle attachment whisk butter for 2-minutes until light and fluffy.
Add granulated sugar and whisk well on medium speed for 1-minute. Add one egg and one egg yolk and mix it in.
Scrape down the sides and bottom of the pan as per your needs.
Finally, add Peppermint extract and pure vanilla extract and mix well at medium-high speed.
Gradually add flour in parts followed by baking soda. Whisk on a very low speed until combined. The cookie dough should be quite thick. See the image for a better visual.
Finally, add White Chocolate Chips and mix well using a rubber spatula or a wooden spatula until evenly combined.
Press the cookie dough on the bottom of a greased baking pan. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the cake top is slightly brown. It could also take up to 30-minutes. All ovens work differently. Test with a toothpick. If it comes out with a few moist (not wet) crumbs then it's done. To prevent over-browning on the edges you can cover the cookie cake with an aluminium foil at 15-minute mark.
Once the cake is baked, remove from oven and keep it on a wire rack. Once the cake has cooled down to room temperature, use a sharp knife and loosen it from the sides. Serve directly from the pan or do the frosting.
The Peppermint Buttercream frosting is optional. You can also decorate with whipped cream frosting.
Whisk butter at high speed for 2-minutes until light and fluffy. Add icing sugar (1/2 cup) at a time and whisk well. If it's too thick you can use 1-2 teaspoons of milk. Add Vanilla extract and Peppermint extract and mix well. Transfer it to a piping bag with a nozzle of your choice. Snip the edge of the piping bag and do a beautiful frosting on the cookie cake. Decorate the cake with white chocolate chips and crushed peppermint candy canes.
ingredient4: 1 Teaspoon Pure Peppermint Extract do not substitute with Spearmint extract or Mint extract
ingredient6: 2 Cups All-Purpose Flour spooned and leveled (240g)

title: Christmas Shortbread Bell Cookies | Easy Christmas Ornaments Cookies
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
In a bowl combine butter and sugar along with peppermint extract. Once it gets creamy, add the Flour and Baking Soda. Combine everything to make the cookie dough. Divide the dough into two parts. In one part, add few drops of Red Food Color and leave the other one white. The dough will be crumbly, but when you bring it together it will form a dough. Cover and freeze the cookie dough for 15 minutes or refrigerate for 30 minutes. Preheat the oven to 350F or 180C
Bring both red and white cookie dough together and roll the dough. It should have a white and red marbled effect to it. Use a Bell-shaped cookie cutter to cut out the cookies. Take them out in a cookie baking dish and bake for 10 minutes.
After the cookies have baked, cool them down completely. Melt white melting wafers in the oven and take them up in a zip-lock bag or piping bag. Snip the edge and drizzle over the cooled cookies. Decorate with Red and Green Christmas Sprinkles. Serve.

title: White Chocolate Peppermint Shortbread Cookies
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
In a large mixing bowl, combine the melted butter, sugar, and peppermint extract until it gets creamy. Add the flour, baking soda, and Red Food Color to the dough and combine everything to make a cookie dough.
Your cookie dough will be dry, but when you bring it together it will clump together. If it's not coming together, you can add just a tablespoon of ice-cold water and bring it together to make the dough.
Cover and freeze the dough for 10-15 minutes or refrigerate for 30 minutes. Preheat the oven to 350F OR 180C.
Roll small cookie dough balls, flatten them out with your palm, and top them with white chocolate chips and crushed Peppermint Candy canes.
You can use a zip lock bag, throw in all the Peppermint candies in it. Seal the top and crush the Peppermint candies using a rolling pin.
Bake the Cookies for 10-15 minutes.
After the cookies get done, allow them to cool down to room temperature in the same pan in which they got baked. Then serve these cookies.
If you want, you can stuff in more white chocolate chips and crushed Peppermint Candy Canes on the top and then serve!

title: Savory Cheddar Rosemary Christmas Shortbread Cookies
author: Anjali
customtime: Allowing the pie dough to chill: 30 minutes minutes
actualsteps:
In a medium-sized mixing bowl combine flour, butter, and ice-cold water using a pastry blender or pulse in a food processor. You can also use a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment for this step as well. Make sure to not overwork on the dough. Cover the dough with a plastic wrap and place it in the refrigerator for 30-minutes.
Take the dough out. Remove the plastic wrap and place it on a floured surface. Add shredded cheddar cheese, dried rosemary, dried red pepper flakes, salt, and freshly cracked black pepper.
Bring it all together to make a soft dough.
Meanwhile preheat your oven to 350F or 180C. Grease a 9x13" inch cookie sheet with nonstick cooking spray and line with parchment paper.
Roll the dough using a floured rolling pin. Roll it to about 1-inch thickness. Use a star-shaped cookie cutter to cut out the cookies. Poke holes onto the cookies so that they do not puff up and rise. Place them on a greased baking tray.
Bake the cookies in a preheated oven at 350°F for 10-15 minutes or until they get slightly golden brown at the bottom.
Cool them down in the same dish for 10-minutes and then serve.
ingredient1: 1 Cup All-Purpose Flour more for dusting on the surface
ingredient2: 3 Sticks Cold Unsalted Butter cut into small cubes
ingredient3: Ice Coldwater 1/4 cups or As per requirement
ingredient4: ¼ Cup Sharp Cheddar Cheese Shredded
ingredient8: ¼ Teaspoon Freshly Cracked Black Pepper

title: Chocolate Shortbread Cookies
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish with non-stick cooking spray and line it with a parchment paper.
In a medium-sized bowl, mix the flour with cocoa powder, cold butter with your hands or a pastry blender until it gets coarse and mealy.
Now, add 1 tablespoon of Shortening and mix well. Add Granulated sugar and combine it with all the ingredients. It should clump together when your close your fist with the dough in hand
Place it on the countertop and bring it all together to form a small ball. Freeze this covered for 15 minutes or Refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Flour your work surface generously. Place the Cookie dough ball on the Floured surface and press it with your hands so that it gets a disc like shape. Cover it with flour, as much as possible. Use a rolling pin to roll it softly.
Now use a Christmas Tree-shaped Cookie cutter to cut out Christmas Tree shaped cookies from the rolled dough. You can use any other cookie cutter that you like.
Transfer cookies to a prepared baking sheet.
Bake these cookies at 350F for 10 minutes. They will be soft and be looking when done. Let them stay in the baking tray for 10 more minutes at room temperature, before transferring them onto a cooling rack.
In the meantime, melt the dark chocolate. Place a Bowlful of Dark Melting Wafers in your oven. Microwave at high for 1 min. Stir well. Then Microwave at 30 seconds increment, stirring after each interval until the chocolate gets smooth and silky.
You can also do this step on the stovetop. Read instructions in the notes below.
Use a spoon to drizzle melted chocolate on the top half of your Christmas cookies. I have poured it diagonally. You can also pour it on the top half horizontally. Immediately top it with Red and Green Christmas Confetti or crushed Peppermint Holiday Candy canes or Crushed Almonds. Allow them to sit at room temperature for 10-15 minutes and then serve.
ingredient2: ½ cup Unsweetened Cocoa powder 50 grams
ingredient3: 2 sticks cold unsalted butter cubed (1 cup or 226.8gm)

title: Gingerbread Crinkle Cookies
author: Anjali
customtime: Allow the cookies to cool down: 15 minutes minutes
actualsteps:
In a medium-sized bowl mix softened butter with packed dark brown sugar. Use a wooden spatula or a rubber spatula to mix well.
Beat in egg and pour molasses. Mix well.
Preheat oven to 325F or 160C. Grease a 9*13 inch baking dish with cooking spray. Line it with parchment paper. Set Aside
Sift flour, baking soda, ground ginger, ground nutmeg, ground cinnamon, ground cloves, and Kosher Salt. Mix well until combines.
Now add granulated sugar and mix well.
Use an ice cream scoop to scoop out a little portion of the cookie batter and form small balls in your hand.
Coat each cookie in icing sugar generously. Place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Make sure you leave some gap between each cookie. Wrap the baking dish with plastic wrap.
Freeze for 20 minutes.
Roll and re-roll them again in confectioners sugar.
Bake these gingerbread crinkle cookies in a preheated oven at 325°F or 160°C for 10-minutes.
Once done, allow them to cool down in the baking tray for 10-minutes before transferring them to a cooling rack and cooling them for an additional 10-20 minutes.
ingredient1: 2 Sticks Unsalted Butter 1 Cup (Softened at room temperature)
ingredient2: ¾ Cup Packed Dark Brown Sugar 150gm
ingredient13: ¾ Cup Icing Sugar for rolling the cookies

title: Snowball Chocolate Chip Cookies
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
Preheat the oven to 350F or 180C. Grease a cookie baking tray with butter or cooking spray.
Take all the ingredients in a bowl and combine with your hands to make a coarse mixture or just pulse them in a food processor for 1 to 2 pulses or until combined through.
Make small cookie dough balls. The mixture will be dry but when you clump together it would form balls. Form small clumps of the dough and Roll them between your palms and make the cookie dough balls.
Freeze the cookie dough balls uncovered for 15 minutes or refrigerate for 30 minutes, Then pop it directly in the oven and bake for 10-15 minutes.
After the cookies get baked, allow them to cool down to room temperature on the counter for 5 minutes untouched.
Once the cookies are not too hot to touch, fill a bowl with powdered sugar and gently roll the cookies in powdered sugar until they are evenly coated and serve. Re-roll in more powdered sugar if you wish to. Refrigerate until served
ingredient3: 1 cup Chocolate Chips unsweetened or bittersweet
ingredient4: 1 cup Powdered Sugar more to roll the cookies into

title: Christmas Sugar Cookie Truffles
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
Take Sugar Cookies in a zip-lock bag and pound using a rolling pin until you get crumbs. You can also use a food processor to pulse the sugar cookies and get the crumbs.
Combine the Sugar Cookie Crumbs with Cream Cheese. Take 1 tablespoon of it and make a small ball using your palms. Place it on a dish and freeze for 10 min.
Meanwhile, melt the chocolate or almond bark in the oven at 30 seconds bursts. If it doesn't melt properly, add a few drops of coconut oil, stir well, and then melt it.
Dip the Sugar Cookie Truffles in the melted chocolate until coated. Use a fork to coat the sugar cookie truffles. Tap the fork at the edge of a plate to drip off any excess. Carefully, slide it down to another plate using a toothpick.
Top with Sprinklers and serve. If you are not serving immediately, refrigerate until you serve.
ingredient1: 10 Sugar Cookies use Pepperidge farm sugar cookies
ingredient2: 1 tablespoon Cream Cheese (2.02 oz or 14.1gm) brought to room temp.
ingredient3: 1 pack White Melting Wafers or Vanilla Almond Bark 24 oz

title: Chocolate Covered Ritz Cracker Cookies with Peanut butter - No Bake Christmas Cookies
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
Coat one side of the Ritz Cracker with Peanut Butter. Top with another Ritz Cracker.
Melt the chocolate in the oven at 30 seconds bursts. Stir in between each burst. Add a few drops of coconut oil and stir in the chocolate is not melting properly.
Dip the Ritz Cracker in the Melted Chocolate. Dip just until it gets coated with Chocolate. Tap the spoon at the edge of the plate to drip off the excess. Slide it down to a separate plate using a toothpick.
Top with Sprinkles and freeze for 20-30 minutes. If not serving immediately, then refrigerate until you serve it.

title: Buttery Santa Kiss Cookies
author: Anjali
customtime: Resting the dough in the fridge: 30 minutes minutes
actualsteps:
In a large mixing bowl combine butter and sugar. Whisk until creamy using a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment or a handheld mixer. Add Flour, Sugar, Vanilla, and Salt. Mix well.
Add Almond Milk (1 teaspoon at a time) and mix well. If your dough feels too wet then add some flour and adjust accordingly.
If your dough feels too dry then add some almond milk and adjust accordingly. Your dough should be soft yet thick. See the images for a visual.
Cover the dough with a plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30-minutes. Refrigerating the dough is a MUST. If you can chill overnight then it's best. Chilling the dough prevents the cookies from spreading.
Take the dough out of the refrigerator, and let it sit at room temperature for another 10-minutes.
Preheat oven to 350F or 180C and grease two large baking sheets with cooking spray or brush vegetable oil. Line with parchment paper or a silicone mat. Set aside.
Roll the dough into small balls. Take about 3 tablespoons for each ball. Tap it with your palm and place it on the prepared baking dish. Leave some gap between each cookie.
Make a dent with your thumb and pop it in the oven for 10 minutes.
Don't overcook. After 10-minutes they will look soft and underbaked. And, that is how they should be. Allow them to stay on the baking sheet for 10 more minutes before transferring them to a cooling rack.
Make sure the dent is al-right. Once they have cooled, use your thumb to make it look perfect.
In the meantime melt white chocolate in the oven at a 30-second increment. Keep stirring after every 30-second. Once it is soft, open the door of the freezer, place the bowl containing melted white chocolate in your freezer. Let the door be open and continue stirring until its temperature comes down to 28C or 82F.
Divide it into three parts.
Let one part remain white. In one bowl containing melted white chocolate add 2 drops of red gel food color and stir well.
In another bowl containing melted white chocolate add 2 drops of green gel food color and stir well.
In the dent spoon melted white chocolate and place one Hershey's Kiss Chocolate Candy. Use a fork to drizzle melted red and green colored white chocolate on the cookies.
Sprinkle some red and green holiday confetti. Enjoy!
ingredient1: 2½ Stick Unsalted Butter 1¼ Cup or 282g (softened at room temperature)
ingredient4: 1½ Cup All-Purpose Flour use Gluten-Free Flour for GF alternative

title: Buttery Walnut Snowball Cookies
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
Preheat the oven to 350°F or 180°C and grease a cookie baking tray with cooking spray or butter.
In a large bowl, add the All-Purpose Flour, Chopped Walnuts, cubed softened Butter, Granulated Sugar, Kosher Salt, and Vanilla Extract. Combine everything with your hands until it gets coarse and mealy. OR Pulse all the ingredients in a food processor for 1 or 2 pulses or until combined and mealy.
The mixture will be dry, but when you bring it together, it should clump. Form small clumps, roll them between your palms to make them perfectly circular.
Gently place them on the baking dish, separated from each other (about 1 inch gap).
Put the baking tray in the freezer for 15 minutes or refrigerate for 45 min.
Bake the cookies for 15 minutes. Once they are baked, allow them to cool down untouched for just 5 minutes.
Once they are not too hot to touch and have hardened, coat them in powdered sugar.
Fill a bowl or a shallow plate with powdered sugar and gently roll each cookie in the sugar until evenly coated. After rolling, let stand for a 5 minute and re-roll. Keep aside
After 10 minutes, coat it again with sugar and then serve!
ingredient2: 2½ cup Unsalted Butter 5 sticks (softened to room temp)
ingredient3: 1 cup chopped Walnuts or chopped toasted Pecans

title: Christmas Peppermint Sugar Cookie Bars
author: Anjali
customtime: 10 minutes to cool it down: 10 minutes minutes
actualsteps:
Preheat the oven to 350F or 180C and grease a 9x9 inch baking dish with cooking spray or oil or butter.
In a large bowl, using a stand mixer on medium speed or handheld mixer with a paddle attachment, cream the butter and sugar until it gets foamy and light.
Add Eggs, Peppermint Extract, Vanilla Extract. Mix well, until the Egg is completely incorporated.
Sift the AP Flour, Baking Powder, Baking Soda, and Salt into the wet ingredients and stir well until it all gets combined. Add 2-3 teaspoon of Whole milk and combine until well mixed.
Press this into a lined Baking dish with edges of parchment paper hanging out. Evenly spread the batter. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until the top is lightly golden brown. Cool it down completely before proceeding with the frosting.
Using a stand mixer or handheld mixer, combine Cream Cheese, Butter, Vanilla Extract, Peppermint Extract in a large bowl until smooth.
Gradually add Powdered sugar and mix until creamy. If you want to use food color, you can add it now. Mix well, until everything gets completely combined.
Finally, spread this cream cheese frosting over your cooled Cookie bars in a thick and even layer. Top with Sprinklers if desired. Cut using a sharp knife and wipe the knife after each cut to get clean cuts. Serve
ingredient1: 1 stick Unsalted Butter softened (1/2 cup or 113.4gm)
ingredient17: Red and White Candy Cane Christmas Sprinklers or Broken Candy Cane optional

title: Brown Butter Pecan Cookies
author: Anjali
customtime: 10 minutes in the freezer: 10 minutes minutes
actualsteps:
Melt the Butter in a Pan over medium-low heat. As the Butter starts to melt, stir constantly so that nothing sticks to the bottom of the Pan. First, the Butter will bubble, and then it will turn frothy. After some time, it will stop bubbling. Stir again at this point and your Brown Butter will be ready.
It's preferable to do this step of Browning the Butter in a Light colored Pan, so that you can see the butter changing color, right on time. Or else, the Butter might get burnt. (see the video below for a visual)
Once the Butter is brown, quickly take it off the heat and pour into a large mixing bowl. It will sizzle and that's fine.
In the same bowl of Brown Butter, add the Brown Sugar, Vanilla Extract, Granulated Sugar, Salt, Ground Cinnamon, and Ground Nutmeg. Whisk all of the wet ingredients until combined. You do not have to cream this wet mixture using a stand mixer or a handheld mixer. Just whisking it for about 2-3 minutes will be fine. (see the video below for a visual)
Add the Flour, Baking Powder, and the Chopped Pecans into the batter. Mix everything well. Now to bring everything together, add 2 tablespoon of Whole Milk. You can also add Almond Milk or Vegan Soy Milk for a vegan version. Mix this in with the rest of the ingredients and make a thick cookie dough. (see the video below for a visual)
Refrigerate the dough for 20 minutes or freeze it for 10 minutes. After that, get it out, and make small cookie dough balls. (If you're making a big batch of cookies and you have a lot of cookie dough, wrap it up tightly using a Plastic food wrap and then freeze it or Refrigerate it covered with any dish).
Flatten it out with the front of your Palms and place it on your baking dish. Top the cookies with some more chopped Pecan nuts. Press gently, so that they stick to the cookie top. (see the video below for a visual)
Bake the Cookies for 11-12 minutes at 350F. After the cookies get done, allow them to rest in the hot oven for 10 more minutes, and then when you get them out, serve them warm, if you want warm & soft cookies, or cool it down to room temperature if you want chewy and crunchy cookies. Cooling down the cookies will harden it and get them crispy. Serve it.
ingredient1: ½ cup Unsalted Butter 110gm or 1 stick (replace with vegan butter for vegan version)
ingredient8: 2 Cup All Purpose Flour can replace with Almond Flour for GF Version
ingredient10: ½ cup Chopped Pecans more to stuff on the top of the cookies
ingredient11: 2 tablespoon Whole Milk can replace with Almond Milk

title: Witch's Fingers Sugar Cookies
author: Anjali
customtime: 5 minutes to cool down the cookies: 5 minutes minutes
actualsteps:
Preheat the oven to 320F or 160C and mix the wet ingredients - Melted Butter, Vanilla Extract, and Castor Sugar
Add the All-Purpose Flour, Baking Powder, and Salt. Combine everything. Make a soft sugar cookie dough.
Take a small ball of the cookie dough and roll it lightly to get an elongated finger-like shape.
Use your fingers to make the two indents.
Make the ridges using a butter knife, in the middle of those indents.
Add the Almond and make the indent at the tip of the finger. Now, remove it.
Melt Red Candies in a bowl, and use a painting brush to paint the tip of the finger. Attach the Almond over it.
Carefully lift up these Sugar Cookies and place them on your baking dish.
Cover with a foil and Freeze for 15 minutes or refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Bake these cookies for 15-16 minutes. Once they get baked get them out and allow them to cool down to room temperature on the same dish.
Once the cookies have hardened, you can serve it.

title: Spooky Halloween M&M Cookies
author: Anjali
customtime: no resting time required: 0 minutes minutes
actualsteps:
Preheat the oven to 350 F or 180C. Line a 9x13 inches baking dish with silicone mat or parchment paper.
In a mixing bowl, combine AP Flour with Baking Powder, Dark Cocoa Powder, Cornstarch, and Kosher Salt. Whisk until combined.
Mix the Softened Butter with Vanilla Extract, Brown Sugar and Black Gel food color. Use a stand mixer or hand held mixer to cream the wet mixer together until it gets soft and fluffy.
Mix the flour mix with the wet ingredients. Fold everything using a rubber or silicone spatula. Add some milk and mix it with the cookie dough. Fold everything to make the cookie dough.
If your cookie dough is too thin and runny, add some more flour and mix with all the other ingredients. Learn from the video for better reference of the consistency of the cookie dough.
Cover the cookie dough with a plastic wrap and freeze the cookie dough for 5-10 minutes. After 10 minutes, use a cookie scooper to scoop out cookie dough balls. Slightly flatten it out, with the back of a spoon or spatula. (this will help them get the perfect shape)
Stuff the cookies with a few M&Ms on top. Bake these cookies for 11 -12 minutes.
Once baked add more M&M Candies on top. Transfer them to a wire rack to cool down to room temp. Serve warm with a glass of milk.
ingredient8: 1 cup Softened Unsalted Butter at room temp. ( 2 sticks)
ingredient9: ¼ cup Whole Milk can replace with almond milk for vegan version
ingredient10: 2 drops Black Gel Food Color optional
ingredient11: 1 cup M&M Candies Green and Purple Colored

title: Soft Pumpkin Chocolate Chip Cookies
author: Anjali
customtime: 10 minutes to cool down the cookies: 10 minutes minutes
totaltime: Total Time: 1 hour hour 5 minutes minutes
actualsteps:
Preheat the oven to 350F and grease a baking dish.
In a mixing bowl, whisk Melted Butter along with Brown sugar and Granulated sugar, until combined.
Also, add in the Pumpkin Puree and Vanilla Extract and mix well until combined.
In another bowl, combine AP Flour with Baking Soda, Baking Powder, Ground Cinnamon, Pumpkin Pie Spice, and salt.
Combine the wet ingredients with the dry ingredients. Fold with a rubber spatula.
Add the Chocolate Chips and fold with the cookie dough
Cover the dough with cling wrap or foil and chill the dough in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes. This is extremely important. Chilling the cookie dough will soak out excess moisture from the dough.
Scoop out Cookie dough and place them on the baking dish. Flatten out the top with the back of your spoon or scooper. If you skip this, your cookies won't spread.
Bake the cookies for 10-11 minutes or until the edges are set. When you get them out, they will be soft in the center.
Once your Pumpkin Chocolate Chip cookies are baked, cool them down to room temperature. Use a wire rack for even cooling of the cookies.
Once they are cooled, they will be ready to enjoy!

title: Jack Skellington OREO Cookies - Quick and Easy Halloween Oreo Treat for Kids
author: Anjali
totaltime: Total Time: 2 hours hours 30 minutes minutes
actualsteps:
Take the candy melts in a medium-sized mixing bowl. Pop it in the oven and keep stirring at 30-second bursts.
Stir vigorously and make it smooth, silky, and lump-free.
Once it has melted halfway, open the door of the freezer, and place your mixing bowl with melted white candy melts in it. Keep stirring continuously till it gets thinned out, smooth and silky. The cold air from the freezer will make it thinner, smoother, and silkier.
Dip the OREOS in white chocolate one by one with the help of a fork. Make sure you have an excess of white chocolate or else the top won't look smooth. Shake off the excess dripping from sides by tapping your fork onto the edge of the bowl.
Freeze the OREOS for at least 10-hours (or overnight) until the top is completely set.
Use edible food markers to make Jack Skellington on the OREOS. ENJOY!
ingredient2: 3 Packs OREO Orange Creme Chocolate Sandwich Halloween Cookies
ingredient3: 1 Pack Edible Black and Red Color Food Markers

title: Eggless Brown Butter Pumpkin Snickerdoodle Cookies
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
Preheat the oven to 350F or 180 C
Melt butter over low flame. Keep stirring until you have your Brown Butter ready. Cool it down and then use it.
In a bowl, take flour and whisk it with Baking soda, Baking Powder, Pumpkin Spice, Lemon Juice, a pinch of Salt, and Ground Cinnamon.
In a bowl, take the brown butter, add granulated sugar and brown sugar, beat using a handheld mixer until it gets light and fluffy.
Add the Pumpkin Puree, Yogurt, Vanilla Extract, Cider Vinegar and mix it well.
Mix the dry with the wet ingredients. Add some grated Nutmeg and some more ground cinnamon and mix well.
Refrigerate your cookie dough, covered for 30 minutes and then bake it.
Bake your Pumpkin Snickerdoodles for 10-12 minutes at 350F or 180C until the sides are brown.
Dust with Cinnamon Sugar and then serve it.
Serve with warm milk.
Enjoy!
ingredient6: ½ teaspoon Ground Cinnamon plus more for cinnamon sugar
ingredient9: ½ Cup Granulated Sugar plus more for cinnamon sugar

title: Eggless Banana Chocolate Chip Cookies
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
Pre-heat your oven to 350F or 180 C and line a cookie baking tray with parchment paper.
In a mixing bowl take all the wet ingredients and mix until smooth.
Add your dry ingredients to your wet ingredients and fold the mixture.
Scoop out cookie dough and place it on the baking tray.
Bake your Banana Chocolate Chip Cookies for 12-15 minutes or until it gets brown from the sides.

title: Halloween Monster Eyes Cookies
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
In a mixing bowl combine melted butter with granulated sugar, brown sugar, yogurt, milk, vanilla, and black food color. Beat it with a handheld mixer or whisk until well combined.
Sieve and add flour, dark cocoa powder, baking soda, and baking powder into your wet mixture. Combine everything well using a rubber or a silicone spatula.
Chill the dough for 5 minutes in the freezer after covering it with a plastic wrap.
Get the chilled cookie dough out. Make small cookie balls and place them on a lined baking tray. I have used a 9x11 baking tray. You can use any cookie baking tray or even a non-stick Silpat if you want.
Bake these cookies for 11 minutes at 350°F OR 180°C. Press the cookie with a spatula to flatten it out. Cool it down before you insert the candy eyeballs.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookie Bars (aka - Pan Chewies)
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F or 180 degrees C. And, Line a 9x9 inch baking tray with parchment paper.
In a small bowl add butter, light brown sugar and egg. Beat it well until creamy and fluffy, and keep aside.
Sift Flour, Baking Soda, Baking Powder, Kosher Salt and Chocolate Chips. Mix everything using a wooden spatula.
Pour milk and mix well until combined.
Pour the batter in your lined baking tray. Top with more chocolate chips.
Bake for 20-25 minutes.
Cut into pieces and serve with a scoop of ice cream.
ingredient3: ½ Cup Butter softened to room temp
ingredient8: 2 Tablespoon Milk cold (can use Almond Milk)

title: No Bake Halloween Sugar Wafer Cookies
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
Melt your candy melts as per the directions on the package.
Coat half of the wafer cookies with colorful candy melts.
Freeze them for an hour. Push in white chocolate chips for the eyes. You can just push one eye and then take it out to make it look scary. For others, you can cut one chocolate chip in half and then push it in.
For Making Mummy, first coat the wafer cookie in white chocolate then make a zig-zag pattern with brown candy melts. You can fix a white chocolate chip on the top as Mummy's eye.
Use white sprinklers to make a nose and mouth.
ingredient2: 1 Pack Candy Melts Orange, Purple, Green, Brown & White
ingredient3: 1 Pack Halloween Sprinklers Simply White Sprinklers

title: Carrot Cake Cookies with Cream Cheese Frosting
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
Preheat oven to 350F and grease a 9x11 baking tray with cooking spray/vegetable oil/butter.
First mix butter and sugar until light and fluffy. This process is called creaming. Now add egg and vanilla essence. Mix for 2 minutes at medium to high speed with a stand mixer or hand mixer.
Use a sifter to sift and add All-Purpose flour, Baking Soda, Baking Powder, Ground Cinnamon, and Ground Nutmeg in our batter.
Add grated carrots and fold them in the batter with a spoon. Mix well.
Cover the cookie dough in a plastic wrap and keep it in the fridge for some time.
Use an ice-cream scoop or your hands to make small cookie dough balls and place them on the baking tray. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the sides are brown. Let them cool down at the room temperature before transferring to a cooling rack.
Mix cream cheese, pineapple juice, grated carrots, and granulated sugar with a hand mixer or stand mixer for 3-5 minutes until it becomes light and fluffy. Use a spoon to glaze your carrot cake cookies.
ingredient1: ½ Cup Unsalted Butter softened at room temperature

title: Cute Easter Chick Oreo Cookies - Easy Peasy Easter Treat
author: Anjali
totaltime: Total Time: 2 hours hours 15 minutes minutes
actualsteps:
First, dip the Oreos in Yellow candy melt. Freeze them well until coated or about 1 hour.
Meanwhile, melt the White chocolate chips/candy melts using an oven at 30-second increment. Divide it into 2 parts.
Add black food color in one and orange in other. Mix well to make a smooth mix.
Use a dropper to make the Eyes and nose of your Chick Oreos.
Freeze the Easter Chick Oreo Cookies for 1 hour and they are ready!
ingredient3: ½ Cup White Candy Melts or white chocolate chips
ingredient4: Black food color can replace with dark chocolate chips
ingredient5: Orange Food Color Can replace with cut-up Cherries

title: Peanut Butter Easter Bunny Cookies - Cutest Easter Dessert
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
Preheat oven to 350F and grease a baking tray with cooking spray.
Cream Peanut Butter, Unsalted Butter, and Granulated Sugar until light and fluffy with a hand-held mixer or stand mixer.
Add Vanilla Essence, and egg. Whisk well until the egg is combined.
Add in All-Purpose Flour, Baking Soda, and Baking Powder and fold it lightly.
Make two small discs with the cookie dough - one slightly larger than the other. Stick them both by placing another small disc on the back. Cut out four more oval-shapes. Attach two as ears and rest two as paws. Cut out another tiny ball and dip it in white chocolate. Stick it in place of bunny's tail.
Bake in a pre-heated oven for up to 5-7 minutes.

title: Easter Egg Peanut Butter Cookie Dough Truffles
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
Use a hand mixer to mix brown sugar, butter, peanut butter, and confectioner's sugar.
Now sift all-purpose flour into the mixture and mix well until it forms a crumbly kind of texture.
Roll it out and make small Easter Egg shapes with your kitchen knife or egg-shaped cookie cutter or plastic Easter Egg-shaped toys.
Let them bake in a preheated oven for 5-7 minutes and bring them to room temperature.
Melt white chocolate in a double boiler or in a microwave oven by stirring every 30 seconds until it gets creamy and smooth.
Add oil or butter to make it smooth and divide it in three parts.
Add Yellow, Blue and Pink food color individually and mix it well.
Now use a piping bag or a spoon to drizzle this colored chocolate over your Easter Egg Peanut Butter cookie dough truffles.
Let them freeze for a while and enjoy!

title: White Chocolate Chip Cranberry Oatmeal Cookie Bars
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
Preheat oven to 350F and grease a 9x11 baking tray with cooking spray.
Cream butter, brown sugar, and granulated sugar until light and fluffy.
Add Yogurt, some vinegar, and vanilla essence into the mix.
Add flour, cornstarch, baking soda, and baking powder after sieving it in another bowl.
Lightly fold this into the wet ingredients and add cranberries and white chocolate chips.
Bring it all together and keep the cookie dough in the fridge overnight or for at least 2 hours.
Bring the dough to room temperature and roll it out with a rolling pin.
Make small squares or rectangles and put them on the baking tray.
Let them bake at 220C or 420F for 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Let them cool down and then take them out.
Enjoy!

title: Chewy Oatmeal Cranberry White Chocolate Chip Cookies
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
Preheat oven to 350F and grease a 9x11 baking tray with cooking spray. Line it with parchment paper for easy cleanup.
Cream butter, brown sugar, and granulated sugar for 3 minutes at medium to high speed using a hand mixer or stand mixer until light and fluffy.
Add Vanilla Essence, Yogurt, and Vinegar and mix well.
Sieve flour, cornstarch, baking soda, baking powder, and salt into your wet ingredients.
Use a wooden spoon or silicon spatula to fold the ingredients until all are well mixed.
To this add one cup of dried cranberries with white chocolate chips and lightly fold it into the cookie batter.
Chill the dough after covering it in a plastic wrap overnight or for 2 hours.
Take them out and bring the dough to room temperature. Make small 1-inch balls out of cookie dough and press them softly just a little with your palm. Do not make it too flat or thin.
Bake in a preheated oven at 350F for 10-12 minutes.
At 8 minute mark take out your cookies and press in some more white chocolate chips over your cookies.
Bake for the remaining 2-3 minutes in that same preheated oven.
Let them stay in the oven for at least 10 minutes before transferring them to a cooling rack.
Enjoy with a glass of milk!

title: Peanut Butter Oatmeal Cookies
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
Preheat oven to 350F and line your baking tray with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
First cream peanut butter, sugar, and some salted butter in a bowl. Use a hand mixer and whisk well for at least 2-3 minutes at medium speed or until its fluffy.
Throw in egg and vanilla essence and beat well.
In a separate bowl mix refined flour, baking soda, baking powder, nutmeg powder, cinnamon powder and a pinch of salt.
Now, add rolled oats and some peanuts into your dry ingredients.
Finally, add these dry ingredients into your wet ingredients in parts and lightly fold the mixture.
Wrap the dough in a plastic wrap and let it chill for at least 30 minutes or an hour.
Use a cookie scoop to make small cookie balls and place them on your baking sheet. Do not keep them too close. Leave some gap between each cookie ball.
Do not tap the cookies. Let them be fluffy. It will make your cookies tall.
Bake them for at least 10-13 minutes or unless a toothpick comes out clean.
Let them cool in a cooling rack for 10 minutes.
ingredient8: ½ Cup Old Fashioned rolled oats

title: Mint Chocolate Chip Cookies
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
First, take the brown sugar and granulated sugar. Cream it with Butter. Whisk for 2 to 3 minutes in high speed with a hand blender. You can add 2 spoons of Milk as well. It'll ease the process.
Now, you will have to slowly start adding your flour. Add the flour in small batches and keep folding it with the wet mixture.
Do not overmix the flour. Just give it a stir and lightly fold it with the wet ingredients so that it gets well incorporated.
Now ad in the Mint Extract along with a drop of Green food color.
Now add Baking Soda, a Pinch of Salt and Vinegar. Whisk all of this for 2 minutes at low to medium speed, until you get a dough.
Now throw in some Chocolate Chips and Mix it with a wooden spoon
Refrigerate the Cookie dough for 30 minutes. After you get the cookie dough out, it should have a tight doughie consistency.
Use a Cookie Scoop to scoop out your cookies and place the cookies in a greased cookie tray lined with Parchment paper. Do not grease the Parchement Paper as this will flatten your cookies.
Bake these Mint Chocolate Chip Cookies at 350F for 13 minutes.
Allow the cookies to stay in the oven for 5 minutes and then take them out on the cooling rack.
Enjoy the Mint Chocolate Chip Cookies with a glass of warm milk.
ingredient10: ½ Cup Dark Semi-Sweet Choco Chips

title: Healthy Double Chocolate Walnut Oatmeal Cookies - Eggless, Sugar-Free, Flourless Cookies
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
First, mix the Cocoa Powder with Chocolate Chips and heavy cream. Also, throw in the chopped walnuts and whisk it well until all gets well combined.
To this sieve Oats flour along with baking soda
Add in the Vinegar, Yogurt, and Oil. Whisk everything well with a handheld mixer until you get lumpy cookie dough.
Place cookie dough balls in a lined baking tray and bake at 350 F for 12 minutes. After 12 minutes, use a spoon to press the top and continue baking for a further 2 minutes. Allow the cookies to stay in the hot oven for 5 more minutes before you get them out on the cooling rack.
ingredient1: 1 Cup Oats flour Old fashioned rolled Oats
ingredient7: 1 Cup Vegetable Oil Can use Coconut Oil for a healthier option
ingredient8: 2 teaspoon Greek Yogurt Can replace with Sour cream

title: Cute & Soft Easter Thumbprint Cookies
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
Pre Heat your Oven to 375 F
In a mixing bowl, mix together Flour, Baking soda and Baking Powder
In another mixing Bowl, whisk Butter and Sugar for 4-5 minutes using a hand held mixer at high speed.
Sieve the dry ingredients into the wet mixture and fold it with a wooden or silicon spatula
To this add Vinegar, Yogurt and Vanilla Essence
Whisk this mixture using a hand held blender for2-3 minutes or until cookie dough is formed.
Line a 11*8 Baking tray with Parchment paper.
Use your palms to make small sized balls of the cookie dough and place it on the baking tray
Bake your cookies for 7 minutes and 375F
Melt chopped dark chocolate with Butter on a double boiler.
Stir well using a wooden or silicon spatual untill all are well combined
After 7 minutes of baking the cookies allow them to be in the oven for an additional 5 minutes.
Take out the cookies and use your thumb to make small thumbprint over the cookies
Fill the holes with some chocolate ganache
To this place one small M&Ms and allow the cookies to chill

title: Easter M&M Chocolate chip Cookies
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
Preheat your oven to 190C or 370F and line your baking tray with parchment paper.
First cream melted butter, brown sugar, and powdered sugar for 5 minutes or until light and fluffy with a stand mixer or a handheld mixer.
Add egg and vanilla essence and whisk well for another 1-2 minutes.
Sieve the dry ingredients - (refined flour, baking soda, baking powder, and cornstarch) with a siever and add them to your wet ingredients.
Whisk well until everything is combined.
Add M&M, Rainbow Sprinklers and Chocolate Chips into the cookie dough and lightly fold them into the batter. Your batter should not be very moist. It should be dry and soft.
Chill the cookie dough after wrapping it with a plastic sheet for 30-minutes.
Bake your cookies for 10-12 minutes.
Take them out and keep them on a cooling rack.
Once they are at room temperature you can serve it with a glass of milk.
ingredient1: ¼ cup Butter both salted and unsalted works
ingredient12: ¼ Cup Dark Unsweetened Chocolate Chips

title: Nutella Cookies with White Chocolate Chips
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
Preheat oven to 350F and grease a 9x11" baking tray with cooking spray and line with silicone mat or parchment paper.
Add the Butter and Sugar in a large mixing bowl. Cream the Butter and sugar using a stand mixer or handheld mixer until light and fluffy.
Add Egg, Vanilla Extract, Nutella, Milk and mix it well into the batter.
Sieve the dry ingredeints - Flour, Baking soda, Cocoa powder into the wet ingredients in parts and mix just enough with a hand blender or stand mixer.
Fold Dark Semi-Sweet chocolate chips into the cookie dough and cover it with a plastic wrap. Let it chill for 2 hours or over-night in the refrigerator.
Take it out and let it come back to room temperature.
Use an ice-cream scoop to make small balls and place them on a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
Keep at least a 2-inch gap between each ball. Make sure you make a small 1-inch ball.
Bake for 10 minutes and let it chill in the oven for 5 minutes.
Take them out and let them chill in the baking tray for additional 30-minutes
Now, place them on a cooling rack and let them chill at room temperature for additional 30-minutes.
Melt white chocolate in a double boiler. OR Melt White Chocolate Chips with a few drops of coconut oil in the oven at 30 seconds bursts.
Use a spatula to mix melted white chocolate, softened butter with granulated sugar.
When the glaze gets light and fluffy, use a spoon to glaze the cookies.
ingredient12: ½ CUP Chocolate Chips dark, semi sweet

title: Easter Colored Crinkle Cookies
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
Preheat oven to 350F and grease a baking tray (9*11) with cooking spray.
Mix unsalted butter, brown sugar and granulated sugar with a hand mixer or stand mixer.
Add vanilla essence, egg to the butter-sugar mixture and mix until it becomes light and fluffy.
Sieve all-purpose flour, baking soda, baking powder, cornstarch and salt into the bowl of wet ingredients and mix until just combined. Don't over mix. Just lightly fold with your hands or a spoon or a rubber spatula.
Divide your cookie dough into four equal parts into four separate bowls. Make sure the bowls are clean and dry.
Add individual color in each dough and mix well with a spoon or rubber spatula until you get the color you want. Repeat this with all four colors. (Pink, Purple, Blue, and Yellow)
Take a bowl full of confectioner's sugar and coat your cookie dough balls in the sugar until it looks like a small snowball.
Make medium-sized cookie dough balls.
Bake them in a preheated oven at 350F for 10 minutes.
Let them cool down for 5-6 minutes before transferring them to the cooling rack.
ingredient1: ½ Cup Unsalted Butter softened (at room temperature)
ingredient14: 3 Drop each Purple - Mix Pink and Blue

title: Carrot Cake Chocolate Chip Cookies
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
preheat oven to 350 degrees F
First in a mixing bowl cream the Butter and Sugar until smooth and creamy. To this mixture add eggs and vanilla essence. Whisk well until combined
Next, sieve the flour along with baking soda and baking powder into the wet mixture and fold it with a spoon.
Add in the chocolate chips, grated carrots, ground cinnamon, ground nutmeg, and milk. Mix everything well using a spoon and make your cookie dough
Bake your cookies at 360F for 12 minutes or until they start to get brown from the sides.
ingredient2: 1 Cup Unsalted Butter Melted and at room temperature

title: Keto Peanut Butter Oat Cookies - Gluten Free | Sugar Free | Low-Carb | Eggless
author: Anjali
customtime: no resting time required: 0 minutes minutes
actualsteps:
Put the Oven to Pre Heat at 375 F
Mix the rolled Oats and Almond Flour in a large mixing bowl.
To this add the baking soda along with salt, ground Cinnamon and ground Nutmeg. Whisk until combined.
Melt the Peanut Butter and Maple Syrup in the oven. Microwave for 10-15 seconds and fold until combined.
To this add Vanilla Essence and Vinegar and beat until combined. You can use a hand held mixer or stand mixer or just fold using a silicone spatula.
Mix the dry ingredients with the wet ingredients and use a wooden or silicon spatula to mix it. The cookie dough should be thick and sticky to touch.
Within 10 fold your dough will come together.
Add chopped Almonds and Peanuts at this stage (only if you wish to). You can also put it later over the cookies once these have been baked for like 10 minutes.
Finally make small cookie dough balls using a cookie scooper and put these Keto Peanut butter Oat Cookies in a lined baking dish for baking at 375°F for 12 minutes
After 12 minutes, check the cookies. They should be soft from the top and should start getting brown from the bottom and sides. If the cookies haven't spreaded just tap the top using a spatula so that it begins to spread.
Put the Peanut butter Oats Cookies for baking for another 3 minutes.
Keep it in the oven for another 5 minutes
Take it out on a cooling rack and allow them to cool down
Enjoy your Keto Peanut Butter Oat Cookies with a glass of Milk or Tea.
ingredient1: ¼ Cup Rolled Oats (can use oats flour as well) use Gluten Free Oats
ingredient3: ½ teaspoon Baking Soda gluten free
ingredient8: ¼ Cup Chopped toasted Peanuts optional
ingredient12: 1 teaspoon White Vinegar or 2 large Eggs (can use egg whites only)

title: Best Christmas Cookies of the season 🍪
author: Anjali
customtime: allow the cookies to rest: 20 minutes minutes

title: Carrot Wafer Cookies
author: Anjali
totaltime: Total Time: 1 hour hour 10 minutes minutes
actualsteps:
First, melt the candy as per the directions given on the package.
Coat half of your sugar waffle cookies with orange candy melt.
Use a spoon to carefully drizzle green candy melt on the remaining half of the sugar waffle cookies so as to resemble the leaves of your carrot.
Freeze this for 1 hour and take it out right before you're about to serve.

title: Cake Batter Funfetti Chocolate Chip Easter Cookies (eggless)
author: Anjali
actualsteps:
Preheat your oven to 180C or 350 F and line your baking tray with parchment paper.
First cream melted butter, and brown sugar for 3 minutes or until light and fluffy with a stand mixer or a handheld mixer.
Add egg and vanilla essence and whisk well for another 1-2 minutes.
Sieve the dry ingredients - (AP Flour, Baking soda, and Vanilla Cake mix) with a siever and add them to your wet ingredients.
Whisk well until everything is combined.
Add Rainbow Funfetti and Chocolate Chips into the cookie dough and lightly fold them into the batter. Your batter should not be very moist.
Bake your cookies for 10 minutes.
After 10 Minutes, get your cookies out and put in some more chocolate chips and Funfetti on top of the cookies.
ingredient8: ¼ Cup Semi Sweet Choco Chips
